Title: Manager, Finance & Strategy - New Business Verticals
Location: San Francisco, CA; Los Angeles, CA; Denver, CO; Tempe, AZ; Chicago, IL; United States - Remote
RoleDescription:

The Finance & Strategy team is responsible for accelerating the growth of our business by identifying and implementing new opportunities and solutions.  We partner with teams across the company to improve the profitability, scalability, and defensibility of our business model. Were looking to hire strategic thinkers who can model the future, solve complex problems, and collaborate effectively to help carry projects from conception through execution. In this role you will be responsible for working across all line items of the P&L and being a key thought-leader alongside our vertical GMs.

We are looking for a Manager who will play an integral role in building our business strategy and ensure we are making the most efficient investment and capital allocation decisions for New Verticals, the fastest growing segment on Doordash. Location: Los Angeles, CA; San Francisco, CA; Seattle, WA
RoleDescription:
About the Team
The Enterprise Strategy & Operations team is responsible for maximizing team performance and serving as trusted partners to sales leadership in our Enterprise Partnerships & Business Development organization. This team owns cross-functional strategic, analytic, and operational initiatives to best serve our largest revenue driving partnerships across all geographies and business lines at DoorDash. To achieve this, the Enterprise Strategy & Operations team builds strategic plans, executes go-to-market playbooks, builds processes, and partners with cross-functional teams to solve our toughest problems.
About the Role
Were seeking a Data Strategist to uncover insights, shape strategy, and drive high-impact execution across our Enterprise Sales organization.
This is a high-visibility role ideal for someone with strong technical skills, paired with the strategic acumen to work cross-functionally, identify opportunities, and bring data-driven initiatives from concept to implementation.
Youll partner with teams including Account Management, Strategy & Operations, Product, and Data Eng to tackle ambiguous problems, develop analytical frameworks, and influence decisions that support our Enterprise Sales org and scale merchant growth.

Improve Data Foundations: Help identify opportunities to improve data quality and consistency, enabling more scalable and accurate analytics across the business.

BA/BS degree in quantitative or business fields, or equivalent work experience
4+ years of work experience in data analytics, strategy, consulting, or other similar field
Analytical mindset with demonstrated ability to work through complex, ambiguous problems using data
Proven ability to achieve expert level in:

Title: Engineering Manager, Notification Intelligence & Experience
RoleDescription:
About the Team
DoorDash is looking for an Engineering Manager with product sense to lead teams within Growth in the Bay Area or Seattle. This team is responsible for handling a number of initiatives that will fuel DoorDash's growth in the coming years and beyond. These teams consist of engineers from backend, frontend, mobile and ML backgrounds and partner with a number of cross functional orgs throughout DoorDash. The Growth team is responsible for the products that help us acquire millions of new DoorDash customers every quarter and drive millions of incremental orders every month. 
About the Role
Were looking for an Engineering Manager with expertise in Growth, Product Engineering, or Notifications to help scale DoorDashs customer engagement through smarter, more impactful notifications. As a key technical leader, youll partner closely with Product, Analytics, Content, Marketing, Ops, and Engineering to craft personalized experiences that drive meaningful customer actions. Youll lead a team to define and execute the roadmap - whether thats determining the right moment and channel to inform a customer about a relevant promo, or helping shape the future of our notification infrastructure. Your work may span applying LLMs to content generation, leveraging ML to optimize send time and targeting, scaling our platform, and introducing new engagement notifications tailored to user needs. If you're excited about growing customer impact through intelligent and scalable notification experience, this role is for you.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Build and scale a talented team of backend engineers, working alongside Product, Analytics, Frontend, and ML partners to shape the future of customer engagement
Create an environment where engineers grow through mentorship, ownership, and execute with high standards of engineering excellence
Foster a culture of curiosity and lead a data-driven problem solving, where insights guide decisions and innovation
Own the problem spaces, direction and tech vision in collaboration with cross-functional teams
Have opportunities to innovate with cutting-edge AI technologies (e.g., LLMs, recommendation models) to elevate our customer engagement experience
Help shape a culture that thrives on diving into details, obsessing over customer impact, and delivering meaningful results

Were excited about you because...

B.S., M.S., or Ph.D. in Computer Science or a related field
7+ years of industry experience, including 2+ years of engineering management
Proven ability to build and scale customer-facing products in fast-paced, high-growth environments
Good product sense with strong a track record of partnering effectively with Product, Design, and Analytics to shape user experiences
Excellent cross-functional collaboration skills, especially in working with non-technical stakeholders to turn ambiguous problems into scalable solutions
A passion for mentoring and growing engineers, and leading teams through change with clarity and empathy
A bias for action and deep ownershipbalancing high-level vision with attention to execution and details

Why Youll Love Working at DoorDash

We are leaders - Leadership is not limited to our management team. Its something everyone at DoorDash embraces and embodies.
We are doers - We believe the only way to predict the future is to build it. Creating solutions that will lead our company and our industry is what we do -- on every project, every day.

About the Team
Superette is DoorDashs In-House Creative Studio. The role of our team is to establish and continuously strengthen a distinctive, meaningful brand that resonates deeply with our customers and within culture. We turn marketing strategies into compelling, effective creativity to exceed expectations with each of our audiences at every touchpoint. Our commitment is to deliver a consistent and unified brand identity and expression across all surfaces. We create powerful, emotive stories that drive undeniable brand preference and loyalty. Were looking for an experienced, hands-on Creative Director (writer's background) to lead and support a team of creatives and independently manage a variety of projects across all audiences. Work on projects that feel worthy of a place in your portfolio.
Have a lot of autonomy to run projects and grow as a leader.
Collaborate with a team of talented writers, art directors, designers, and social strategists who deeply understand our business and audiences.

Experience a different approach to work compared to traditional advertising agencies.
Go beyond making ads to create experiences, content, product enhancements, and solutions that solve our audiences real problems.

Fully-remote (within the US)

Youve got a portfolio full of smart, well-crafted, famous work that broke into culture

RoleDescription:
About the Team
DashMart is part of the New Verticals division with Doordash and we are a local-fulfillment center owned and operated by DoorDash, offering customers fast, reliable, and high quality delivery. 
About the Role
In this role, youll work within a 5-15k sq ft distribution center, will assist in leading the local warehouse operating team, and in some locations, includes preparing food in a light-prep kitchen, and help the Site Manager ensure we maintain high quality for our customers. 
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Lead: Youll demonstrate compassion and commitment to inclusivity as you lead a team of hourly Operations Associates and Shift Leads. Youll hire, coach and develop high-performing team members, while building a safety-first culture where employees are excited to drive success, personally and for the team. Youll serve as a leading change agent for your site, helping your team to navigate new initiatives and growth projects. Youll tackle onsite escalations, including coordination with cross-functional partners. 
Operate: With your thumb on the pulse of all outcomes for your team, you will be directly responsible for driving results in one or more specific focus areas or a specific shift for your site. To achieve your performance targets, youll drive success through effective scheduling and by executing inventory management processes and deploying best practices from across the network. Youll engage cross-functional partners as needed for support. 
Strategize: Within the focus area(s) assigned by your Site Manager, youll analyze data and make strategic recommendations and execute actions regarding resource allocation, workflow, warehouse organization and when to engage cross-functional partners. You may also lead some process improvement projects. 
Delight: We are customer-obsessed. Youll coach and empower your team to provide a highly quality customer experience with every order. Quality metrics such as order accuracy and fulfillment speed will be key measurements of success for your team. Youll also work cross-functionally with central teams from our inventory to training teams to ensure your team has the tools and resources theyll need to deliver. 

Were excited about you because... 

Youre a proven leader. You have managed high-performance teams of 5+ employees with successful performance and employee development outcomes.
You relish ownership. Youre excited to have ownership in a new and rapidly growing business. No problem is too big or too small for you, and youre ready to show up however needed for your team. 
You solve problems from first principles.  Youre excited to solve problems in innovative ways, and you resist this is how its always been done thinking.
Youre unafraid of ambiguity.  Rapid change and learning is exciting to you, and you thrive in ambiguous, startup environments.
Youre analytical. You let data win arguments. You are a data-first problem solver and you have experience using Excel or Google Sheets to analyze data, including using basic formulas and creating pivot tables. 
You have 3+ years experience: In Operations, Warehouse Logistics, Customer Service, Retail Management, Fulfillment, or related field

Market Competitive pay

Health benefits starting Day 1 (Medical, Dental, & Vision)
401k match
Gym membership reimbursement (up to $75/month)
Monthly DashPass subscription including access to HBO max and Lyft Discounts
Employee Assistance Program
Career advancement opportunities

Represent the voice of our stakeholdersincluding internal teams, merchants, and vendorswhen shaping the roadmap for operational improvements.

You have experience leading teamsboth directly and through influencetoward shared goals and outcomes.

Title: Senior Manager, Ethics and Compliance
RoleDescription:
DoorDash is hiring an experienced leader to help us uplevel our ethics and compliance function. This high-visibility, high-impact position will establish the global ethics and compliance strategy in close partnership with legal, HR, product, policy, engineering, audit, and business teams. You will play a pivotal role in influencing DoorDashs ethical standards and ensuring compliance with regulations while fostering a culture of ethical conduct across the enterprise. 
About the Role
As a Senior Manager of Ethics and Compliance, you will develop the strategy and drive DoorDashs ethics and compliance function to ensure our policies, processes, and frameworks meet the required ethical standards. You will work cross-functionally across various regional compliance teams and business units to align on ethics and compliance policy development and propagation. This will be a highly visible role where you will work with executive leadership to report on the health of the ethics and compliance function, mature the program over time, and foster a robust organizational speak up culture. 
Were looking for someone who thrives in fast-paced settings and brings a pragmatic approach to ethics and compliance. The ideal candidate will be someone who is creative, is a self-starter, operates at the lowest level of detail, and is driven to make an impact. 
About the Team
DoorDashs Legal Team has built a reputation within the company for our highly collaborative and supportive approach to counseling, always with a bias for action. This role will sit within our newly branded Compliance, Privacy, and Data Responsibility team, which consists of a diverse group of professionals with a shared passion for providing creative and best-in-class service to our business partners. We go above and beyond to help accelerate and protect the business, and above all else, we value and respect each other as teammates. Were looking for a team builder who can successfully work across the legal team, as well as the broader company. Join us!
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Set and champion the vision for the ethics and compliance program, including developing objectives and key results for this function.
Stay current on external global ethics & compliance business environment changes and implement policy enhancements to reflect the risks.
Enhance protocols for receiving, documenting, and responding to ethics-related violations and conflict of interest reports, ensuring a commitment to transparency, confidentiality, and accountability. 
Design and implement a comprehensive compliance training strategy that aligns with the overall global compliance program and supports a culture of compliance.
Identify process gaps and roll out technical solutions including innovative uses of technology for process enhancements or efficiencies.
Reporting on DoorDashs ethics and compliance program to the executive leadership team.
Monitoring and managing reports made to our reporting hotline, and ensuring that all reported matters are appropriately investigated and documented in a timely manner.
Coordinating annual ethics and compliance risk assessments and managing the ethics and compliance teams contribution to DoorDashs organizational risk-management system.
Managing our annual compliance certification and training campaigns.
Developing, launching, and analyzing the results of our periodic culture of compliance survey.
Serving as a subject matter expert in the areas of meals, gifts, travel, entertainment, conflicts of interest and similar areas.
Conducting internal investigations, as required, and preparing investigation reports of findings and conclusions with respect to the matters investigated.

Were excited about you because...

You work autonomously while exercising sound judgment in a fast-paced environment.
You thrive equally on quick, risk-based decisions and nailing big projects. 
You are technically fluent.
You have a proven ability to balance legal risk and business objectives.
You have a positive attitude and high EQ. No job is too big or too small!
You are committed to fostering a diverse, equitable, and inclusive work environment and have prioritized participating in DEI initiatives in past roles.

Qualifications

8+ years of experience in ethics and compliance, risk management, policy, or a related field.
Proven track record of managing ethics and compliance programs in a fast-paced environment, preferably in technology or finance sectors.
Strong understanding of regulatory requirements and industry standards related to ethics, compliance, and corporate governance.
Knowledge and understanding of the practical application of the US Department of Justice and Federal Sentencing Guidelines in assessing the effectiveness of compliance and ethics programs.
Experience working cross-functionally to align on ethics and compliance standards and processes.
Ability to think laterally and anticipate downstream effects of activities that could impact compliance.
Strong written and verbal communication skills, able to clearly convey regulatory complexities to various stakeholders, including presenting reports to senior management and regulatory bodies.
Demonstrated ability to analyze complex issues and make sound decisions in high-pressure situations with discretion and integrity.

Title: Lead Product Manager, ATO/Identity Intelligence
Location: San Francisco, CA; Seattle, WA; New York, NY; Chicago, IL
RoleDescription:
About the Team
Our Integrity, Payments Fraud and Trust & Safety Product team is dedicated to ensuring a safe and trusted experience for all customers across our platform, including Consumers, Merchants, and Dashers. We tackle complex challenges, from preventing payment fraud and ATO to ensuring authenticity, to building regulatory compliance capabilities, all while balancing risk mitigation and providing a seamless user experience. Our team partners closely with cross-functional groups, including Engineering, Data Science, Compliance, and Risk Operations, to drive strategic initiatives that protect our business while fostering growth.
About the Role
The DoorDash marketplace is expanding rapidly beyond just restaurants as we become your door to more." As we add new products, geographies, ways for Dashers to earn, as well as use cases to help consumers save time, were expanding and enhancing our fraud capabilities to be best in the industry at keeping our platform safe and trustworthy. We strongly believe that trust is the most important attribute of an online marketplace, and the Integrity team ensures that we maintain this trust.
One of the most important areas within Integrity is building and advancing our Account Takeover prevention efforts and deepening our Identity Intelligence signals and capabilities. As we scale and continue to enter new business verticals, safeguarding the integrity of our platform becomes critical. 
Were seeking a Lead Product Manager to drive product strategy and execution in the Account Takeover (ATO) and Identity Intelligence space, securing our overall account integrity efforts. This is a pivotal role to protect our customersDashers, Merchants, and Consumersfrom fraud while enabling seamless, secure access. Our goal is to make account access delightful, frictionless and easy for our customers while making it impossible for fraudsters to breach.
You will be the subject matter expert and driver behind our account integrity / account protection roadmap, building industry-leading defenses that leverage AI and ML models to enable real-time, accurate decisions with high recall. Youll lead a cross-functional team involving Data Science, Design, Engineering, Strategy & Operations, and Analytics to help protect the platform and fuel healthy growth for DoorDash. 
You will report into the Director of Trust & Safety and Integrity within the Customer Support Experience and Fraud organization.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Lead Strategy & Execution: Own and execute the end-to-end product vision for ATO prevention and identity intelligence across the DoorDash platform.
Fraud Signal Development: Partner with engineering, data science, and risk teams to build real-time detection and prevention systems leveraging behavioral biometrics, device intelligence, and advanced ML models.
Incident Response & Mitigation: Serve as a product lead in response situations when large-scale ATO activity is detected, coordinating mitigation efforts and post-mortems.
Measurement & Optimization: Own and influence OKRs for account health, attack rates, false positives, and recovery success, and iterate rapidly on product enhancements.
Develop scalable solutions for complex risk problems, including unauthorized payments, KYC, and dispute resolution.
Partner cross-functionally with teams such as Customer Experience, Design, Engineering, S&O, and Analytics to enhance security and trust in our platform.

Were excited about you because...

You bring a 7+ years of experience solving complex ATO and Identity Intelligence product challenges and building scalable solutions 
You have expertise with behavioral biometrics, device fingerprinting, and signal enrichment to verify user identity
You have expertise in fraud detection signals and scoring frameworks (e.g., risk scores, velocity checks, IP reputation).
You have experience leading cross-functional teams and working with LLM and machine learning-based risk models
You have proven abilities in driving product strategy, vision, and roadmap alignment 
Youre an execution power-house 
You thrive in ambiguous environments and can make data-driven decisions while balancing trade-offs between user experience and risk mitigation
You have experience presenting product reviews to senior executives
You have empathy for the users you build for
You are passionate about DoorDash and the problems we are solving for

DashMart is a local-fulfillment center owned and operated by DoorDash, offering customers fast, reliable, and high quality delivery. Title: Assistant Site Manager
RoleDescription:
About the Team
DashMart is part of the New Verticals division with Doordash and we are a local-fulfillment center owned and operated by DoorDash, offering customers fast, reliable, and high quality delivery. 
About the Role
In this role, youll work within a 5-15k sq ft distribution center, will assist in leading the local warehouse operating team, and in some locations, includes preparing food in a light-prep kitchen, and help the Site Manager ensure we maintain high quality for our customers. 
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Lead: Youll demonstrate compassion and commitment to inclusivity as you lead a team of hourly Operations Associates and Shift Leads. Youll hire, coach and develop high-performing team members, while building a safety-first culture where employees are excited to drive success, personally and for the team. Youll tackle onsite escalations, including coordination with cross-functional partners.

To achieve your performance targets, youll drive success through effective scheduling and by executing inventory management processes and deploying best practices from across the network. Youll engage cross-functional partners as needed for support.

You may also lead some process improvement projects. 
Delight: We are customer-obsessed. Youll coach and empower your team to provide a highly quality customer experience with every order. Quality metrics such as order accuracy and fulfillment speed will be key measurements of success for your team. Youll also work cross-functionally with central teams from our inventory to training teams to ensure your team has the tools and resources theyll need to deliver. 

Were excited about you because... 

Youre a proven leader. You have managed high-performance teams of 5+ employees with successful performance and employee development outcomes.
You relish ownership. Youre excited to have ownership in a new and rapidly growing business. No problem is too big or too small for you, and youre ready to show up however needed for your team. 
You solve problems from first principles.  Youre excited to solve problems in innovative ways, and you resist this is how its always been done thinking.
Youre unafraid of ambiguity.  Rapid change and learning is exciting to you, and you thrive in ambiguous, startup environments.
Youre analytical. You let data win arguments. You are a data-first problem solver and you have experience using Excel or Google Sheets to analyze data, including using basic formulas and creating pivot tables. 
You have 3+ years experience: In Operations, Warehouse Logistics, Customer Service, Retail Management, Fulfillment, or related field

You have flexibility in your schedule. As the leader of the site, you will need to ensure your team and the site is fully supported, which will include regularly scheduled late-night and weekend hours.

Title: Senior Analyst, Access Command
Location: New York, NY; Seattle, WA; San Francisco, CA; Tempe, AZ; Sunnyvale, CA
RoleDescription:
About the Team
You will be a part of the Network Operations Excellence (NOE) team which is a component of the Global Support and Integrity Operations (GSIO) organization. The primary role of this organization is to provide the best support for Dashers, Consumers and Merchants to maximize Customer retention while minimizing cost. We achieve this by creating feedback mechanisms and insights to influence process design and resource allocation to improve the experience. Our ultimate objective is to enhance the experience of all customers engaging with DoorDash, and improve key performance indicators (KPIs). To achieve this objective, the team will operate and execute support experiences.
About the Role
We are looking for a detail-oriented and proactive Senior Analyst to join our Access Command team. In this role, you will play a key part in the delivery of mission-critical provisioning services for our global BPO support agents. Youll ensure seamless tool access, conduct thorough compliance audits, and lead process improvement initiatives.
This is a high-ownership role requiring strong problem-solving skills, cross-functional collaboration, and the ability to manage technical complexities with confidence. You will report into the Strategic Planning & Execution Manager within the NOE organization.
Generally, working hours are 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM PST, Monday through Friday, with flexibility for 2nd or 3rd shift support depending on business needs.
Must be based in one of the following locations: New York, Seattle, San Francisco, Tempe, Sunnyvale and able to to travel pending the needs of the business. Required to make bi-yearly trips for team on-sites. 
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Provision and manage user access across multiple platforms (e.g., Weaver, Sigma, Snowflake, OKTA Admin, Salesforce, Jira, Slack, Amazon Connect, and proprietary DoorDash tools).
Support onboarding, offboarding, and lifecycle access management for internal and external (BPO) support teams.
Perform comprehensive audits to ensure data integrity and compliance with SOX/SOC standards.
Triage high-priority access issues and work closely with vendor partners and internal stakeholders to resolve them swiftly.
Troubleshoot complex identity issues (e.g., authentication failures, provisioning errors, access discrepancies).
Lead continuous improvement initiatives such as SOP development, automation efforts, and system cleanups.
Integrate identity platforms with SaaS and internal applications using SAML, SCIM, OAuth, and OpenID Connect.
Engage directly with senior leadership to manage escalations and drive alignment on strategic access initiatives.
Support and educate end-users on IAM processes and tools to promote efficiency and self-service.

Were excited about you because you...

Have 3+ years of experience in access management, provisioning, or technical support in a fast-paced, global environment.
Possess in-depth knowledge of security protocols, SOX/SOC compliance, and access control principles.
Are proficient with access management tools like OKTA, Jira, Salesforce, and Amazon Connect.
Have a working knowledge of SQL and can use it to troubleshoot and validate access data.
Demonstrate strong ownership, communication skills, and the ability to influence without authority.
Thrive in changing environments, learn new technologies quickly, and manage multiple priorities effectively.

About the Team
As one of DoorDash's core operations teams, Customer Experience, ensures that when there are bumps in the last mile, there's always someone there to help make things right. Our team designs, manages, and operates DoorDash's large and growing global network of support centers, with the ultimate goal of delivering an outstanding customer experience as reliably as possible.
About the Role
The Senior Associate role will report into our Consumer Experience Lead and lead the strategic planning to drive industry-leading customer experience initiatives for our DashPass subscribers as well as our most loyal and active customers. This person will report out on core success metrics, develop strategies to optimize those metrics and lead cross-functional teams to implement those strategies in a timely and impactful manner. 
This role is perfect for someone who wants to develop a strategic mindset as well as the operational rigor to bring that strategic mindset to life. 
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Partner with teams within customer experience, and our product, engineering, and tools teams to improve processes and the resulting customer experience for our customers
Produce, dig into and use data and insights to identify opportunities to improve speed, quality, effectiveness, and customer experience
Accomplish your recommendations from start to finish, from digging into Excel/SQL to creating a budget to implementing timelines, aligning partners, testing ideas, achieving and measuring results
Partner with support and company-level leadership to guide priority projects

You solve problems from first principles.  Youre excited to solve problems in innovative ways, and you resist this is how its always been done thinking.
You thrive with a diverse set of responsibilities.  You love working across a breadth of disciplines and teams.  
Youre analytical.  You let data win arguments, and youre comfortable pulling your own data in SQL or modeling in Excel.
Youre persuasive. You are an effective communicator, speaking as if youre right and listening as if youre wrong. You meet people on their level.

RoleDescription:
About the Team
The Vendor Operations team within the Merchant Experience organization is responsible for managing the day-to-day operations and performance of our offshore vendor partners. These vendors are critical to our success, delivering high-quality solutions across key process flows, strategic initiatives, and support functions. We ensure that all vendor work meets our rigorous quality standards and service level agreements (SLAs), enabling smooth, scalable, and reliable operations.
Our Vendor Support cohort is entering an exciting phase of growth and transformation. As we expand our scope to include oversight of all outsourced Merchant Support operations, we have a unique opportunity to reimagine and enhance the foundation of our support model. We're seeking a leader who thrives in dynamic environments and is energized by the challenge of driving impactful, transformative change.

As a Project Supervisor for Vendor Support Operations, you will be on the front lines of our transition and transformation effort. Youll own the performance and accountability of vendor partners who handle merchant support interactions, ensuring they meet key metrics such as SLA compliance, QA, and operational throughput. Youll also lead the development and maintenance of our internal Knowledge Base, creating clarity and structure in a time of change.
This role isnt about inheriting a perfect systemits about stepping into a legacy structure and making it better. Youll need grit, strong operational instincts, and the ability to bring order to ambiguity. Youll act as a strategic thought partner, identifying gaps, proposing solutions, and helping us rebuild and scale merchant support processes for the future.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Help lead the transition of merchant support operations into a new organizational home
Assess inherited support workflows and recommend optimizations based on quality, efficiency, and scalability
Act as the primary liaison with external vendors, ensuring alignment on expectations, priorities, and execution
Drive performance through ownership of SLA tracking and feedback loops
Lead the buildout and ongoing improvement of the internal Knowledge Base, enabling vendor agents to work more accurately and independently
Identify process breakdowns and inefficiencies, and work cross-functionally to implement solutions
Serve as a trusted partner to internal teams like CX, Product, Strategy & Ops, Operations, and Audit during this transitional period
Help manage change across stakeholders and vendors, from documentation updates to rollout communications
Own progress tracking, vendor accountability, and performance reporting during a critical time of operational change

Were excited about you because you have...

35 years of experience in support operations, contact center/vendor management, or process improvement
Experience managing BPO vendors and driving accountability through metrics and structured feedback
A strong operational mindset and the confidence to lead through complexity and change
Experience building or maintaining Knowledge Bases and documentation processes at scale
A data-driven approach, with proficiency in Google Sheets (including pivot tables, formulas, and data validation) or similar BI/reporting tools
Excellent communication skills and the ability to build trust quickly with cross-functional and vendor partners
A bias toward action and comfort operating in ambiguous, rapidly changing environments
Strong prioritization and project management skillsyou can juggle multiple initiatives without losing sight of the big picture
Familiarity with CX or support platforms like Salesforce, or similar systems is a plus

The DoorDash legal team has built a strong reputation within the company for our confident, supportive approach to in-house legal counseling, always with a bias for action. Our north star is helping our business drive growth, and we deeply value growing together as a team. Most of all, we are passionate about constantly improving our practice and what we have built as a company.

DoorDash is hiring an exceptional, business-minded deal lawyer to join our Commercial Legal team. You work alongside them with key partners throughout the company, including Business Development, Strategy, and Finance, to close first-of-kind strategic partnerships and high-value deals. You will report into the Director, Commercial Legal, who leads the team that supports all strategic partnership deals for DoorDash Legal.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Lead, teach, and learn from an exceptional team of lawyers and legal professionals.
Negotiate strategic partnerships and high value deals (and invent entirely new kinds of deals) in close partnership with the leaders of our business.
Take on high-impact projects in a fast-paced environment.
Join a close-knit, caring team of outstanding professionals.

Were excited about you because...

You have a track record of building strong relationships and closing high-visibility deals.
You have deep experience leading the drafting and legal negotiation of major deals in collaboration with C-level execs.
You have provided legal support for business development and/or strategic partnership teams.
You dont miss the forest for the trees, but you also dont miss the trees.
You work autonomously and exercise sound judgment in a fast-paced environment.
You have a proven ability to balance legal risk and business objectives.
You love to cheer for your teammates.
You foster empathy, collaboration, and mutual respect in your practice, and you default toward assuming good intentions about others.
You are curious, humble (no task is too big or too small), andthrough it alldont take yourself too seriously.
You are committed to fostering a diverse, equitable, and inclusive work environment and have prioritized participating in DEI initiatives in past roles.
You have a J.D. and are admitted to any US state bar.
You have 8+ years legal experience in a law firm or in-house legal department, including 4+ years house.

Title: Senior Manager - Tax Advisory & Planning
RoleDescription:
About the Team
Its an exciting time to join our rapidly growing Tax team and be a part of the fast growth the Company is experiencing, particularly with new product initiatives! The Tax team is heavily involved in the operations of the business that impact Dashers, Merchants and Customers.  As a key partner to the business, we are involved at the front end on plans for new products and country expansions as well as the sales and onboarding process with new Merchants. As DoorDash continues to expand its business lines, product offerings, and global footprint, partnering with the business teams to bring tax awareness for such initiatives continues to grow in importance.
About the Role
The key area of focus of this role will be to support DoorDashs various (and growing) business lines with a goal of unlocking and advancing opportunities for our rapidly-scaling businesses, while managing risk levels associated with the tax issues stemming from such efforts. The role will be part of the Tax Advisory and Planning function, supporting various new product initiatives as well as owning and driving tax product initiatives and other tax planning projects. 
A successful candidate will be able to build successful relationships within Tax and across the broader company, simultaneously manage multiple cross-functional projects and initiatives, recommend and support the implementation of product solutions that satisfy DoorDashs tax obligations, provide tax advice on tax and non-tax initiatives, and implement automated and scalable processes to support the rapid expansion of both DoorDash and the Tax team.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Actively partner with a variety of DoorDash teams, including product, engineering, legal, accounting, and finance on new products, initiatives, and expansions of existing products. 
Provide DoorDash teams with applicable daily and strategic input to minimize tax risks while advancing goals and expansion of the business.
Project manage new product, expansion, process improvement, and operational projects for the Tax team, including the creating project plans, setting project timelines, and tracking deliverables and action items.
Operate at the lowest level of detail, diving into all things that directly or indirectly impact tax for DoorDashs products and initiatives in order to ensure compliance while also helping unlock and grow the business.
Communicate with stakeholders at all levels on project plans, status, and important issues.
Design scalable playbooks that document the teams tax policies and procedures. 
Provide tax advice within the Tax team on strategic tax planning initiatives, legislative developments, and other ad hoc matters.
Manage external advisors as necessary. 

Were excited about you because...

You have 8+ years of experience in tax, finance (including accounting), legal, project management, consulting, or related experience

High-growth or early-stage startup experience is a plus.
Experience managing large consulting, advisory, or other project engagements preferred.

You have a proven track record of managing cross-functional projects with multiple dependencies in a fast-moving environment.
You have demonstrated success in your ability to explain complex tax issues in a clear and understandable manner.
You roll up your sleeves and do whatever is necessary to drive results, even if it's outside your normal areas of focus.
You have a strong attention to detail and analytical, organizational, and problem-solving skills. 
You have excellent interpersonal and communication skills, and can motivate people at all levels across a variety of job responsibilities.
You approach your role with a strong moral compass and integrity.

At DoorDash, our customers are at the center of our product strategy and we believe that an amazing customer experience is the key to our success.

We create the entire customer experience  onboarding, restaurant discovery, placing an order, DashPass (our subscription service), and much more  and ensure that our products are easy to use and delightful.

Influence your team's approach to product development, shaping the team's culture, processes, and practices. 
Improve the lives of millions of DoorDash customers every day.

You are a principal-level designer with 10+ years of experience. 
You are a role model for product quality and user-centric product development. 
You are able to navigate, define and drive highly complex product architecture system changes.
You actively engage your teammates and proactively initiate new programs. 
You're enthusiastic about collaboration and team-building.

The Finance & Strategy team is responsible for accelerating the growth of our business by identifying and implementing new opportunities and solutions. Title: Culinary Trainer Lead - Dashmart Kitchens
RoleDescription:
About the Team
DashMart is a new kind of online grocery store owned and operated  by DoorDash. Customers order their convenience, grocery and prepared foods in the DoorDash app, and our team members prepare, pick and pack orders in a real, brick-and-mortar store for our Dashers to deliver to our customers with quality and speed. Our customer promise is: Fresh, Local, and Reliable. Were open early and close late - some sites even run 24/7! Dashmart Kitchens is a team within Dashmart focused on building and operating kitchens to bring fast, affordable restaurant and grocery selection to consumers. 
About the Role
Dashmart Kitchens is looking for a people-focused trainer who excels in a fast-paced, remote environment and is excited to roll up their sleeves and lead from the front. In this role, youll be helping us launch our Dashmart Kitchens, focusing on training local operators. You'll administer training and ongoing quality audits for multiple restaurant concepts - with the support of our Culinary, Kitchen Operations, and Project Management teams. You will report to the Head of Kitchen Operations.  

New Dashmart Kitchens Store Launches in the Field - Work hands-on with our Merchant Partners to administer training & support in the field, ensuring all managers and cooks are properly executing our recipes and following procedures. 
Ongoing Quality Auditing - Perform ongoing Host partnership visits and audits to ensure Hosts maintain consistent high-quality operations.

Youre excited about this opportunity because you...

Are passionate about working with people and love to be hands-on training with culinary teams
Love helping improve operations and contributing ideas to improve our training quality and onboarding experience based on data and an ever-evolving business. 
Are passionate about partnering with restaurants to help grow their businesses
Have the ability to perform audits and compile & communicate feedback in an effort to improve culinary and operational quality.
Love to build processes, playbooks, and can adjust training materials and methods to accommodate onboarding needs.

Were excited about you because...

You're self-motivated, positive, and a team player. You work well with others, but also excel in roles with little oversight - relying on your own drive and self-discipline.
You're scrappy. You are willing to do whatever it takes to get the job done whether it's digging into a new process to determine how best to communicate it to Host Partners or helping troubleshoot a technical issue.
You have 3+ years of experience cooking and managing in a high-volume kitchen environment including fast-casual, QSR, and from-scratch restaurants
You have 2+ years of experience in a field training or training development role, ideally with a restaurant group.
You have a knack for organization and are proficient in Google Docs/Sheets. You are a data-driven decision maker who is comfortable compiling your findings in documentation that can be shared with the broader team.
You are willing to travel and be on-site in dynamic restaurant environments

Why Youll Love Working at DoorDash

We are leaders - Leadership is not limited to our management team. Its something everyone at DoorDash embraces and embodies
We are doers - We believe the only way to predict the future is to build it. Creating solutions that will lead our company and our industry is what we do -- on every project, every day
We are learners - Were not afraid to dig in and uncover the truth, even if its scary or inconvenient. Everyone here is continually learning on the job, no matter if weve been in a role for one year or one minute
We are customer-obsessed - Our mission is to grow and empower local economies. We are committed to our customers, merchants, and dashers and believe in connecting people with possibility
We are all DoorDash - The magic of DoorDash is our people, together making our inspiring goals attainable and driving us to greater heights 
We offer great compensation packages and comprehensive health benefits

Title: Associate Supervisor, Merchant Operations - New Verticals
RoleDescription:
About the Team
The New Verticals team exists within the Merchant Services org and is dedicated to the build and maintenance of Merchant Catalogs. More specifically, we create and update catalogs for Merchants to sell to customers on our platform. Our team receives bulk inventory data from Merchants and translates that information into high-quality data, to make items as shoppable as they are in store.Catalog specialists know all things catalog and help to enrich our workflows by identifying process gaps and opportunities to build and implement new tooling or train our vendors to increase quality and efficiency. We also provide backend support for our Merchants and the core Catalog teams. We work primarily within Google Sheets, MODE Analytics, JIRA, and Salesforce.
About the Role
As an Associate Supervisor within the Enterprise Catalog team, you will support the ENT Catalog Supervisor in overseeing a team focused on building and maintaining high-quality catalog data for our largest merchant partners. Your work will directly impact catalog accuracy, process improvements, and the merchant experience.
This role emphasizes catalog quality and cross-functional project execution, including identifying and resolving data issues, supporting tooling enhancements, and implementing scalable solutions. Prior experience in people management or technical operations is strongly preferred. You should be comfortable navigating ambiguity, guiding a team through shifting priorities, and partnering with stakeholders across the business.
This is a hybrid role with some required in-office days, plus opportunities to join All-Hands events, planning sessions, and team-building activities.
A Day in the Life Might Include...

Leading a catalog quality initiative from discovery to implementation  identifying a root cause (e.g., miscategorized SKUs), partnering with stakeholders to align on a fix, and driving adoption across teams.
Reviewing Red Pipe build escalations, vendor feedback, or merchant-submitted changes and collaborating with VMO or S&O to close quality gaps.
Meeting with specialists for 1:1 coaching or unblocking operational challenges during a catalog build.
Owning project updates in a cross-functional sync  aligning timelines, surfacing risks,and ensuring execution stays on track.
Pulling or reviewing data to identify catalog issues (e.g., incorrect taxonomy, invalid restrictions) and flagging them for correction.
Supporting internal process audits or workflow refinements to improve build consistency and reduce manual rework.

Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Help oversee a team of catalog specialists, supporting day-to-day operations and performance coaching.
Act as a subject matter expert in catalog quality, working through ambiguous workflows and helping to identify root causes and long-term fixes.
Lead and support cross-functional projects that improve catalog accuracy, taxonomy standards, and tooling efficiency.
Provide real-time support through 1:1s, team syncs, and proactive troubleshooting.
Partner closely with internal teams (e.g., VMO, Integrations, Product) to resolve escalations and improve merchant onboarding outcomes.

Were excited about you because you...

Are passionate about operational excellence and team development.
Can translate complex catalog issues into actionable next steps for both technical and non-technical audiences.
Enjoy identifying process gaps and collaborating on long-term solutions.
Thrive in dynamic environments and can confidently lead your team through change.
Are proactive, independent, and a strong communicator.

Title: Team Lead, Community Defense
RoleDescription:
About the team...
The Community Defense team improves the quality of DoorDash operations through the adjudication of background checks, inbound appeals and support inquiries, and screening-related functions. On-demand food delivery has many advantages; however, there are extremely challenging logistics to ensure DoorDash is delivering the best service to the Customers, Dashers, and Merchants.
Community Defense presents a united front to protect the experience of Customers, Merchants, and Dashers while solving these logistical challenges. This teams work helps in maintaining and building internal and external relationships while protecting DoorDashs brand. We work with our stakeholders to solve and mitigate escalations, monitor day-to-day quality, improve response times, and drive tool usage and efficiencies. This position is a tremendous opportunity to join a fast-growing team that is hyper-focused on improving the quality of DoorDashs operations.
About the role...
As a Team Lead on our Community Defense Team, you will directly manage frontline agents responsible for providing the highest quality care to our Dashers at the forefront of our business. This role appeals to you because you're a leader, operator, and problem solver. Youll be responsible for managing the day to day operations with an expanding company while maintaining and improving on bold quality and productivity metrics for your team. Youll also become an expert on our teams workflows while acting as a main point of escalation and working to unlock process efficiencies and share best practices.
You will report into a Supervisor of Community Defense in our Trust and Safety Organization.
You're excited about this opportunity because you will...

Lead a team of motivated individuals who are focused on customer success in order to deliver on operational KPIs
Support your team by being present and approachable, answering questions, hosting weekly 1-on-1 and team meetings, and providing real-time feedback
Establish and manage your team to individual and team goals and objectives and communicate performance to management and other stakeholders
Coordinate daily workflow assignments within the team and adjust resources to meet service level agreements with the business
Operate as a Subject Matter Expert by creating, distributing, and presenting performance reports in order to identify trends and highlight opportunities for improvement
Help scale the team and department to keep up with the growth of DoorDash

Were excited about you because...

You are a leader with a strong desire and natural ability to motivate a team, set and achieve targets, and manage career growth and team performance
You increase results, and are constantly evaluating how and whether your teams activities are achieving the desired, measurable impact
You are an owner, always looking for opportunities to better your work product
You are comfortable making tough decisions that balance the trade-off between quality and quantity
You have a Bachelors degree or equivalent experience
You have a mind and talent for process improvement

Experience with adjudications, case work and government documents

RoleDescription:
About the Team
DashMart is part of the New Verticals division with Doordash and we are a local-fulfillment center owned and operated by DoorDash, offering customers fast, reliable, and high quality delivery. 
About the Role
In this role, youll work within a 5-15k sq ft distribution center, will assist in leading the local warehouse operating team, and in some locations, includes preparing food in a light-prep kitchen, and help the Site Manager ensure we maintain high quality for our customers. 
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Lead: Youll demonstrate compassion and commitment to inclusivity as you lead a team of hourly Operations Associates and Shift Leads. Youll hire, coach and develop high-performing team members, while building a safety-first culture where employees are excited to drive success, personally and for the team. Youll serve as a leading change agent for your site, helping your team to navigate new initiatives and growth projects. Youll tackle onsite escalations, including coordination with cross-functional partners. 
Operate: With your thumb on the pulse of all outcomes for your team, you will be directly responsible for driving results in one or more specific focus areas or a specific shift for your site. To achieve your performance targets, youll drive success through effective scheduling and by executing inventory management processes and deploying best practices from across the network. Youll engage cross-functional partners as needed for support. 
Strategize: Within the focus area(s) assigned by your Site Manager, youll analyze data and make strategic recommendations and execute actions regarding resource allocation, workflow, warehouse organization and when to engage cross-functional partners. You may also lead some process improvement projects. 
Delight: We are customer-obsessed. Youll coach and empower your team to provide a highly quality customer experience with every order. Quality metrics such as order accuracy and fulfillment speed will be key measurements of success for your team. Youll also work cross-functionally with central teams from our inventory to training teams to ensure your team has the tools and resources theyll need to deliver. 

Were excited about you because... 

Youre a proven leader. You have managed high-performance teams of 5+ employees with successful performance and employee development outcomes.
You relish ownership. Youre excited to have ownership in a new and rapidly growing business. No problem is too big or too small for you, and youre ready to show up however needed for your team. 
You solve problems from first principles.  Youre excited to solve problems in innovative ways, and you resist this is how its always been done thinking.
Youre unafraid of ambiguity.  Rapid change and learning is exciting to you, and you thrive in ambiguous, startup environments.
Youre analytical. You let data win arguments. You are a data-first problem solver and you have experience using Excel or Google Sheets to analyze data, including using basic formulas and creating pivot tables. 
You have 3+ years experience: In Operations, Warehouse Logistics, Customer Service, Retail Management, Fulfillment, or related field
You have 1+ years of experience managing a team 
You have flexibility in your schedule. As the leader of the site, you will need to ensure your team and the site is fully supported, which will include regularly scheduled late-night and weekend hours.

As the manager for the Fulfillment Intelligence team, you will manage a team of backend, full-stack, and machine learning engineers. You will be responsible for driving the technical vision, strategy, and execution of the team charter.

Collaborate with machine learning engineers to steer demand shaping, ETA modeling, and fulfillment inputs in ways that reduce cost without sacrificing quality

Scale the team by growing internal talent and attracting world-class talent
Grow in your career with unique and challenging opportunities to expand your skill set
Collaborate with partner teams to explore opportunities to reduce fulfillment costs and improve fulfillment quality

BS, M.S., or PhD. in Computer Science or related field
2+ years leading product engineering teams as an EM
You have 7+ years of industry experience
Youre an owner - driven, focused, and quick to take ownership of your work
You are impact driven - you sign up for and drive high-business impact
A strong hands-on technical leader and strong product sense
Humble - youre willing to get into the details and youre open to feedback

RoleDescription:
About the Team
The Enterprise Strategy & Operations team is responsible for maximizing team performance and serving as trusted partners to sales leadership in our Enterprise Partnerships & Business Development organization. This team owns cross-functional strategic, analytic, and operational initiatives to best serve our largest revenue driving partnerships across all geographies and business lines at DoorDash. To achieve this, the Enterprise Strategy & Operations team builds strategic plans, executes go-to-market playbooks, builds processes, and partners with cross-functional teams to solve our toughest problems.
About the role
Were seeking a Data Strategist to uncover insights, shape strategy, and drive high-impact execution across our Enterprise Sales organization.
This is a high-visibility role ideal for someone with strong technical skills, paired with the strategic acumen to work cross-functionally, identify opportunities, and bring data-driven initiatives from concept to implementation.
Youll partner with teams including Account Management, Strategy & Operations, Product, and Data Eng to tackle ambiguous problems, develop analytical frameworks, and influence decisions that support our Enterprise Sales org and scale merchant growth.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Drive Strategy with Data: Use SQL and other analytics tools to explore complex datasets, identify key business opportunities, and frame insights into actionable strategies.
Own Projects End-to-End: Take ambiguous ideas and turn them into well-defined projects. Collaborate with stakeholders to define hypotheses, scope efforts, conduct analyses, and execute solutions.
Partner Cross-Functionally: Work closely with Enterprise teams to align priorities, share findings, and ensure strategic decisions are supported by rigorous data analysis.
Build Decision-Making Tools: Design and automate dashboards, models, and reporting infrastructure that provide clear insights and support long-term growth strategies.
Influence with Storytelling: Craft clear and compelling narratives that communicate complex insights in a way that drives alignment and action.
Improve Data Foundations: Help identify opportunities to improve data quality and consistency, enabling more scalable and accurate analytics across the business.

Were excited about you because...

You are a strong business thinker, able to use first principles to solve challenging business problems at their root level
You are data-driven, able to analyze data with strong attention to detail and accuracy, and passionate about telling the story behind the numbers
You are able to craft your data insights into presentations that are relatable, succinct, sophisticated, and impactful
You are results-oriented, always evaluating whether our team's activities are achieving the desired, measurable impact
You are a team player who enjoys collaborating with a diverse team and a variety of stakeholders
You are comfortable in a fast-paced, constantly changing team-oriented environment and able to manage multiple deadlines simultaneously

Qualifications

BA/BS degree in quantitative or business fields, or equivalent work experience
4+ years of work experience in data analytics, strategy, consulting, or other similar field
Analytical mindset with demonstrated ability to work through complex, ambiguous problems using data
Proven ability to achieve expert level in:

Querying languages and data analysis tools such as SQL and Python
Data analysis tools like Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets
Presentation software like Microsoft PowerPoint or Google Slides
Data visualization platforms like Tableau or Sigma

Strong written/verbal communications and presentation skills

Title: Site Manager
RoleDescription:
About the Team
DashMart is part of the New Verticals division with Doordash and we are a local-fulfillment center owned and operated by DoorDash, offering customers fast, reliable, and high quality delivery. 
About the Role
In this role, youll manage a 5-15k sq ft distribution center, the local warehouse operating team, and be responsible for ensuring we maintain high quality for our customers. 
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Lead: Recruit, lead, coach & retain a high-performing team of Shift Leads (3+) and Operations Associates (6+). Set your team up for success to work safely and productively. As a leader, you will be responsible for building a strong, positive culture and will be accountable for driving strong employee satisfaction scores. Youll partner with your Shift Leads to effectively delegate daily tasks and ensure high performance from your team. 
Own: You will own the day-to-day operations of one of our DashMart warehouses, and in some locations, includes preparing food in a light-prep kitchen, ensuring the site processes run smoothly, efficiently and safely. Youll own scheduling and be responsible for managing a labor budget. You will be responsible for ensuring your warehouse meets site-level metric goals. 
Delight customers: Lead your team in providing our customers with the best possible experience on each and every order. You will be responsible for maintaining key quality metrics including order accuracy and fulfillment speed. Work cross-functionally with central teams including our inventory and training teams to provide your team with the tools and resources to achieve this goal.  
Strategize: Use data to identify pain-points or areas of inefficiency within our warehouse and current processes. Design, build and execute process improvement projects to improve our warehouse operations, quality metrics, and the employee experience.

Were excited about you because... 

Youre a proven leader. You have managed high-performance teams of 10+ employees
You act like an owner. You do what it takes to support a 24/7 business across multiple shifts. Youre excited to have ownership over a new and rapidly growing business.
You solve problems from first principles.  Youre excited to solve problems in innovative ways, and you resist this is how its always been done thinking
Youre unafraid of ambiguity.  Rapid change and learning is exciting to you, and you thrive in ambiguous, startup environments
Youre analytical. You let data win arguments. You are a data-first problem solver and you have experience using Excel or Google Sheets to analyze data, including using basic formulas and creating pivot tables.

You have 3+ years of experience managing a team
You have a college degree, or relevant professional work experience

Title: Platform Engineer
RoleDescription:
About the Team
The Global Safety and Security team is responsible for advancing DoorDash by protecting people, property, operations, brand, and reputation. We manage safety and security risks and deliver value across the business through agility, technology, and a people-first approach. Our team strives to always be in front, and therefore, our people anytime, anywhere.
About the Role
DoorDash seeks a Platform Engineer to design, integrate, monitor, and evolve Global Safety and Security systems for over 300 locations worldwide. This individual contributor will be deeply technical, owning the infrastructure, integrations, and observability layers critical to security technology operations.
Youll be hands-on with infrastructure and systems, while also driving automation, observability, and self-healing solutions that reduce friction across the enterprise. Youll work closely with Engineering, IT, Security, and Facilities, translating technical details into actionable insights for cross-functional stakeholders. If you're someone who thrives at the intersection of systems engineering and real-world safety technology, this role is for you.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Build and support world-class safety and security platforms using leading-edge technologies
Extend platform observability by designing telemetry, alerting, and metrics dashboards to ensure uptime, performance, and response agility
Develop APIs and integration layers between safety systems (access control, video management, mass notification) and central enterprise platforms
Use SQL and visualization tools (e.g., Sigma) to drive real-time operational awareness and reporting
Engineer self-healing and automated responses for fault detection, escalation, and resolution
Deploy infrastructure and observability solutions to the cloud (AWS, GCP, or Azure) and on-prem environments
Establish data pipelines that collect, enrich, and analyze signals from sensors, IoT devices, and infrastructure
Champion and drive security, compliance, and resilience as part of every engineering decision
Support CI/CD and infrastructure-as-code workflows using tools like Terraform, Ansible, Jenkins, and Git
Translate complex technical concepts into clear insights for diverse, non-technical stakeholders
Create and implement several automation systems for IoT devices and systems

Were excited about you because you...

Have 4 - 7+ years of experience in platform engineering, infrastructure, or observability engineeringideally in global, distributed environments
Have multiple years of experience using Terraform and Ansible for IaaS and automated configuration deployments
Know how to administer both Linux (RedHat, Ubuntu, Microsoft) and Windows-based systems
Bring expert-level knowledge of DevOps tools CD\CI, Jenkins, and Git
Bring a deep understanding of observability frameworks, metrics collection, log aggregation, and incident automation
Are fluent in SQL and data modeling, and can turn data into insights using tools like Sigma, Looker, or similar BI platforms
Have built integrations using RESTful APIs and understand how to design scalable, maintainable interfaces
Bring experience with Axis Camera (a plus). API\SDK, ONVIF, RTSP streams
Have some foundation in networking, DNS, DHCP, Switching\Firewall
Have the Certified Information Systems Security Professional  (CISSP) certification from isc2.org or can obtain certification within twelve (12) months of hire
Know your way around both Linux and Windows environments and have managed systems via Ansible, Terraform, or similar tools
Are familiar with access control, video surveillance, and IoT technologies (bonus for Genetec experience)
Can communicate clearly, simplify the complex, and advocate for users in every system you build
Are comfortable working across time zones and teams, and can lead large-scale projects independently
Are passionate about resilience, safety, and the intersection of physical and digital security

Why Youll Love Working at DoorDash

About the Team
The Enterprise Ad Sales Team is responsible for the marketing vision, development, and growth of our largest advertising partnerships. This team is rapidly growing, and is seeking additional team members to build an industry-leading ads and promotions business across DoorDashs advertising offering. The growing DoorDash ads business will quickly become the single best place for advertisers to market to local customers, in an ecosystem that benefits all parties.
About the Role
As the Offsite Ads Sales Lead, you will develop the strategy for our fast-growing offsite advertising solutions, working horizontally across the brand-direct ad sales counterparts. You will function as the industry specialist, with deep product knowledge and a keen appreciation for competitive offerings. In this role, you will be responsible for being in-market with clients ultimately in service of achieving their objectives and increasing mutual value for both advertisers and DoorDash. You will also work in close partnership with product, strategy & operations and sales marketing to optimize the flywheel of what we build, how we bring it to market, and how we optimize it over time. You will report into the Head of New Ventures within the Ad Sales org, as part of our Enterprise Sales & Business Development organization.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Serve as a specialist with deep knowledge of DoorDashs growing offsite offering and the broader retail media offsite landscape 
Operate autonomously as the only person in a role of this kind, while simultaneously building broad relationships across the Ad Sales organization
Wear a sales hat while working in a highly cross-functional capacity at the intersection of product, strategy & operations and sales marketing
Develop the infrastructure for long-term partnerships and ideate/execute scaled initiatives with advertisers and platforms across our ads offering and beyond.'
Establish and grow senior relationships with key stakeholders at both the client and agency level across the US.
Educate, empower and enable team members across all levels of advertiser and agency organizations.
Own sales pipeline for offsite media spend, from planning and forecasting through to negotiation and execution.
Serve as the primary voice of the offsite media landscape within DoorDash, informing product roadmaps and go-to-market strategies, and ultimately ensuring we build for offsite needs now and in the future. 
Partner with vertical sales teams to co-pitch offsite media solutions.
Accelerate brand-specific advertiser growth through and in partnership with key stakeholders.

Were excited about you because...

You have a first-hand understanding of the offsite advertising landscape and operating model, as well as subject matter expertise in programmatic and measurement
You consistently apply rigorous organization skills and ability to thrive in an ambiguous/fast paced environment
You think both analytically and creatively, and are excellent at balancing quantitative and qualitative business needs
Your bias for action creates impact in the short-term, yet your strategic mindset enables a long-range vision that inspires those around you
You are a master of stakeholder relationship management with excellent communication and negotiation prowess 
You are entrepreneurial at the core, with the capability and track report to build a team down the line
As an added bonus, you may be familiar with the core verticals in which DoorDash operates - restaurant, convenience/grocery, retail and consumer packaged goods
